dmc:Content.dmc:Title: DMC-S1000DBIKE-AAA-D05-20-00-00AA-000A-A_010-00_EN-US_1_1 - Bicycle Maintenance Planning Document
dmc:Content.dmc:Introduction: This document outlines the maintenance planning for a bicycle, detailing various tasks and their associated requirements.

dmc:Section.dmc:Title: Overview
dmc:Section.dmc:Content: The document defines a series of maintenance tasks, each with specific prerequisites, resource needs, and inspection criteria. Tasks vary in complexity and required skill level.

dmc:Task.dmc:Title: 1. Post-Ride Inspection (Task ID: 001)
dmc:Task.dmc:Description: A routine inspection performed after each ride to identify immediate issues.
dmc:Task.dmc:InspectionCriteria: Visual check for damage or wear.

dmc:Task.dmc:Title: 2. Tire Pressure Check (Task ID: 002)
dmc:Task.dmc:Trigger: Weekly or before each longer ride.

dmc:Task.dmc:Title: 3. Brake System Check (Task ID: 003)
dmc:Task.dmc:Description: Inspecting brake pads, cables, and levers for wear or damage.
dmc:Task.dmc:InspectionCriteria: Proper brake function and pad thickness.

dmc:Task.dmc:Title: 4. Chain Lubrication (Task ID: 004)
dmc:Task.dmc:Description: Applying lubricant to the chain for smooth operation.
dmc:Task.dmc:Trigger: As needed, based on riding conditions.

dmc:Task.dmc:Title: 5. Hub Bearing Cleaning (Task ID: 005)
dmc:Task.dmc:Prerequisites: Rear wheel removed (referenced DM Code: S1000DBIKE, system DA0, sub-system 2)
dmc:Task.dmc:Trigger: Every 6 months or after excessive exposure to water/dirt.
dmc:Task.dmc:ExternalRequirement: Referenced external publication: D6-1234, "My Publication", January 2007, Rev 1.

dmc:Section.dmc:Title: Key Considerations
dmc:Section.dmc:Content: Tasks require varying levels of skill, from basic operator tasks to those requiring a qualified supervisor/mechanic.
Some tasks reference external documents or DM codes for more detailed information.
Each task has a defined trigger for when it should be performed.
The `applicabilityReference` (app-MK1-9) likely refers to a higher-level document defining the scope and context of this maintenance plan.
Tasks like Hub Bearing Cleaning have defined thresholds (e.g., 6 months) and limits for inspection.
